meta.v: Pratica de oyto feguras; Auto das regateyras per Antonio Ribeiro; Pratica dos compadres.
Chiado, António Ribeiro. Various: Pratica de oyto feguras; Auto das regateyras per António Ribeiro; Pratica dos compadres. [Lisboa]: German Galharde, 8, 1 br.; 10f. ; 10f. il.
Biblioteca Nacional de Portugal; Fac-simile provided at http://www.purl.pt/6958; http://www.purl.pt/6932ç http://www.purl.pt/6933.
Chiado, António Ribeiro. Prática de oito figuras; Auto das regateiras; Prática dos compadres. Online edition by José Camões. http://www.cet-e-quinhentos.com
Centro de Estudos de Teatro, Universidade de Lisboa

w.comment: In Portuguese sixteenth-century plays, French are usually depicted as people of malicious character.
A proverb used in other plays by Chiado.
A character from Fernando de Rojas's play, Celestina.
'ele' refers to Faria; the Portuguese usage allows a 3rd. person pronoun instead of the 2nd.
Final verses from St Simeon's Song, originally from Luke 2:32 (CET-UL Edition).
Versicle that begins each one of the canonical hours, except the 'matina', followed by 'Domine labia mea' (adjuvando me festina).
Semi-colon included (instead of period in the CET-UL edition; see meaning).
Period included (unlike in the CET-UL edition, according to sense, not pace of reading)
Period included (unlike in the CET-UL edition; see meaning).
In the original, this rubric is printed together with the first verse.
In the original this rubric appears together with the first verse.
From John 19: 30: 'cum ergo accepisset lesus acetum dixit consummatum est et inclinato capite tradidit spiritum'.
The form 'ele' refers to the 2nd. person (Ambrósio da Gama), according to the CET-UL edition.
The repetition of 'as minhas' may be incorrect; in this case, this is a false verse.
"Cristão novo residente em Tomar, autor de um rifão muito glosado por diferentes poetas quinhentistas" (CET-UL edition).
A wild plant with bitter juice. In this expression, it means 'in a difficult way'.
In the original 'olhai-me negro', but syntax requires the use of the definite article.
Reference to Alexander the Great, and his generosity.
The word 'que' is repeated in the original version.
'amores' in the original, 'amoras' according to rhyme and the Madrid edition (CET-UL edition).
This verse seems hypermetric, except if 'e' is excluded.
This verse seems hypermetric, except if 'e' is excluded.
This verse is hypermetric, except if 'o' is excluded.
This verse is hypermetric, except if we had 'dai' instead of 'dai-me'.
This verse is hypermetric, except if 'mas' is excluded.
Rhyme and a similar form further below lead us to believe the form is 'criença'; though the original and meaning is 'criança'.
'infundir' - 'verter líquido em; por roupa em infundiça' (CET-UL edition).
This verse is hypermetric, except if 'e' is excluded.
This verse is hypermetric, except if 'e' is excluded.
In the original 'vai almeyrim', but not in the BNM version.
Old measuring unit, the correspondent to 1,10metres.
'outras danças' - in the original; but in the singular according to the rhyme and the BNM version.
'tarro, recipiente de cortiça para transportar alimentos'.
Rhyme requests that this word be acute/oxytone.
'carmear'= 'desfazer os nós da lã para a cardar'.
'Trigo moído na mó borneira, negra e dura'.
'lançou-mo' instead of 'lanço-mo', according to BNM version.
'primeira e última tábua de um tronco serrado, com mais imperfeições'
'pano usado para cobrir a massa de farinha durante a fermentação'.
Some versions regularize the spelling to 'Briatiz'.
We chose this variant instead of 'dou lá', considered equally possible in the CET-UL edition, because of parallelism in the use of the preposition with 'd'abrir'.

The original shows, in the beginning of the previous verse and of this verse, the words: 'aqui brado' respectively. This should be understood as an indication of the author for the actor to shout. Inadvertently, the original editor included this comment together with the rest of the text.
This verse is hypermetric, except if we use 'comprir regra' instead of 'comprir a regra'.
This element appears together with the previous verse, but once it probably won't be pronounced, the CET-UL version puts it apart.
This verse is hypermetric, except if we exclude the first 'e', beginning with 'de noite'.
Possible reference (in inverted order) to pau-d'água, a plant whose roots keep a liquid able to be used to quench the thirsty traveller.
This verse is hypermetric, except if it begins by 'água'.
Inserted word due to the context.
This verse is hypermetric, another possibility of reading is 'com vossa Beatiz'.
'rede de emalhar, de fio bastante fino'
This verse is hypermetric, except if it begins by 'um'.
This verse is hypermetric, except if it begins by 'outro'.
'Vasilhas em que se pisa a uva'.
'fartes - bolos de açúcar e amêndoas, envolvidos em farinha de trigo'.
The indication of the character is lacking in the original.
'não na me' in the original, but 'não me' in the Madrid version.
'tecido de algodão muito fino; touca de pano'.
In the original, 'coellos', but see the BNM version.
'morilho = objeto a que se encostam as achas na lareira'.
'traze-o' in the original, but not according to the BNM version.
Divergent reading from the CET-UL version, where 'se ua' is interpreted as 'seora'.
In the original, 'Lourenço', but see context and the BNM version.
Missing word in the original, but present in the BNM version.
Comadre is referred to as 'Lianor Vaz'.
Cavaleiro is referred to as 'João d'Aveiro'.
'rede para cobrir cavalos, a fim de protegê-los de moscas'
Comma included. We follow Pimentel's edition in not creating a new sentence at this point.
Punctuation changed in the CET-UL edition.
Period included (though not in the CET-UL edition).
'nômina' - bolsa em que se guardam orações, relíquias, ou talismãs.
In the original the character is not indicated.
The word 'pera' is repeated in the original.
'elas' refers to Isabel and Silvestra. Cf. Francisco Manuel de Melo (Carta de Guia de Casados) on the exchange of 2nd person pronouns for 3rd person pronouns.
Inserted word due to the meaning and metrics.

Period included. We do not follow exactly either the Pimentel or the CET-UL version proposed readings; the CET-UL proposes as a 2nd hypothesis that 'Se a ele castigara' begins the sentence, but there is already a conditional in 'se quer resisti-lo', where the null subject shall be intepreted as the daughter.
'em empa' = 'em tempo de pôr as estacas nas vinhas para segurar as videiras'.
In the original, 'Bra.' (Brásia) but impossible from the context.
Period included. This and the following sentence seem to be comments about the wine.
'vinho de má qualidade' (vs. vinho de orelha)
'assentai como nunca, insípido/sensabor' (as if talking to the wine).
'argau' - espécie de canudo que se mete na pipa, para tirar amostras de vinho.
'peça a que se encostram as achas na lareira'
The character name is presented in the previous page, too.
In the original we find 'fernando', but it must be Estêvão, from the context.
This verse and the previous one seem to correspond to a song also referred to in Vicente's 'Comédia de Rubena'.
